title: Virtual Fitness Education Design Through Observational Learning and Random Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational exercise physiology and understanding of physical education pedagogies
context.additional_context: Structured acquisition of various exercise techniques for pre-service teachers, designed to apply motor learning theories to actual classes, with self-directed learning via virtual trainer apps on personal devices in asynchronous environments

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more fitness education design plans based on motor learning theories (observational learning, random practice)
Learners identify core elements of exercise techniques (posture, breathing, intensity) with 80% accuracy by analyzing virtual trainer demonstration videos
Learners design personalized four-week exercise programs applying random practice strategies and document reflections in a journal
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
